column4: Does NFS allow unix style permissions?  I mean, if I use a NFS share on a remote server as my users home folders can I set appropriate permissions?  I know I can't with samba/cifs
It's a Windows Storage Server 2008.. I guess I experiement and find out.. :)
NTFS is POSIX complaint.. Oh ,maybe not for ACLS, tho.
just naming, links, and timestamps
hard links are, from what i'm readying.. but acl are not
Well darn.. So I guess my hope of having /home on a windows server is a lost cause?
why on earth would you put /home on ntfs?
my MAS has six TB of storage.. centralized backup.. built in redundancy..
why ntfs?
it's a Windows Storage Server.
as others have already told you /home on ntfs is a bad idea
why not use a seperate storage partition?
i could i guess.. but i wanted it on the Windows NAS.. And I wouldn't know what other filesystem to use other than NTFS.
what do you put on the /home partitions that you need access to them from windows?
i just don't get why you can't just save a whole lot of bother and use a seperate storage partition
it's files transfered from vendors.. they were using ftp but for hipaa compliance i'm switching that to sftp.
seperate storage partition where?
there is no hard and fast rule that says you must absolutely use /home as a storage partition
yeah, i actually had their home folders on my samba share but had permission issues.
yeah, you don't put /home on ntfs
yeah, so it's all the same issue.. i'll just share the home folders from ubuntu instead of putting them on the NAS
